Title: Half Baked - Pitch Training
Hosts: Christoph RichterMarine PopoffNetwork School
Date and Time: Sunday, March 16 at 4:30 PM - 6:00 PM GMT+8
Location: 13th floor dinner space
Description: â€‹Ever tried to sell the world on "ASTRONAUT CHICKEN" with only 120 seconds on the clock? Welcome to HALF BAKED â€“ where random words become billion-dollar ideas (or hilariously epic failures)!â€‹HOW IT WORKS:â€‹ğŸ² The audience shouts out two completely random wordsâ€‹ğŸ§  You have 30 seconds to concoct a business planâ€‹â±ï¸ Then just 2 minutes to pitch your improvised startupâ€‹ğŸ‘‘ The crowd votes on which ridiculous concepts based on how well the pitch is structured - and how well thought through the idea is.â€‹STAGE FRIGHT? PERFECT!â€‹Terrified of public speaking? THIS IS YOUR EVENT! There's no better way to conquer stage fright than pitching a "MUSICAL CACTUS" to a room of laughing supporters. With zero preparation possible and everyone in the same chaotic boat, the pressure disappears. No judgment, just fun times and the sweet rush of surviving your two minutes in the spotlight!â€‹WHAT TO EXPECT:â€‹ğŸ­ Zero preparation (seriously, you can't plan for "MEDIEVAL BLOCKCHAIN")â€‹ğŸ”¥ Quick-fire thinking that impresses potential investors and teammatesâ€‹ğŸ¤£ Guaranteed laughs and networking that doesn't feel like "networking"â€‹ğŸ• Free pizza (because your brain needs fuel for this madness)â€‹ğŸ˜Œ A supportive crowd that cheers for effort, not perfectionâ€‹Whether you're a seasoned entrepreneur or just curious about startup culture, HALF BAKED shows what happens when creativity meets pressure in the startup world.â€‹Come for the chaos, stay for the connections. Who knows? Your "TELEPATHIC UMBRELLA" pitch might just be crazy enough to work!

Title: Daily Mental Reset (Evening) - Aum (Om) Chants
Hosts: KritikaNetwork School
Date and Time: Sunday, March 16 at 8:00 PM - 8:30 PM
Location: VIP Lounge 7 - 13th floor
Description: â€‹This exercise is intended to bring the body to a peaceful stateâ€‹Process -â€‹Deep inhaling and exhaling - 3 roundsâ€‹Aum Chants - 21 roundsâ€‹Meditation - 6 minsâ€‹â€‹Reasoning -â€‹The sounds aa, oo, and mm activate three different chakras in the body (aligned to areas near the stomach, heart and throat) - which inturn allows energy to flow within and through the body seamlessly. Immediately after, sitting in silence while focusing on the area between the eyes, allows us to feel the difference in energy flow and reset accordingly.â€‹Helps with feeling grounded and at ease, while going through regular daily activities.â€‹â€‹Looking forward to seeing you :)â€‹â€‹PS - Luma doesn't allow recurring events - I'll keep updating dates on the same page for nowâ€‹Cheers!
Attendees: 9 Going

Title: Game Theory & Tokenomics - PART 1
Hosts: 0xStef
Date and Time: Tuesday, March 18 at 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM
Location: Ping Pong Room
Description: â€‹"Show me the incentives, and I'll show you the outcome" is a well-known quote attributed to Charlie Munger.â€‹Join us and discover how game theory drives the world and how you can harness it.â€‹PART 1 (Theory)â€‹You willlearn how incentive systems shape everythingfrom tax schemes to corporate shares and points-based rewards, and connect the dots to your favorite cryptocurrencies (BTC, ETH, SOL, USDC, NS Points). Learn how to design a token, engineer its supply, and even build demand for it, the most challenging part.â€‹PART 2 (Light Workshop)â€‹In a follow-up event, you'llprototype your own mini incentive model, present it to others, and discuss pros/cons of the showcased models.â€‹PART 3 (Heavy Workshop)â€‹And if there is appetite, we may expand the series with another event where you'll be building your own token/contract, deployed onchain. ğŸ”—

Title: OpenAI: New Tools for AI Agents
Hosts: Bayram Annakov
Date and Time: Tuesday, March 18 at 4:30 PM - 5:30 PM
Location: PingPong Room, Floor 13
Description: â€‹Join us for an engaging meetup where we'll delve into OpenAI's latest announcement of tools designed to build AI agents. Following our previous sessions on AI Agents â€“ State of the Union, this event will adopt a practical approach. Bayram will demonstrate how he has utilized these new tools to develop specific AI agents aimed at automating sales processes.â€‹In their recent announcement, OpenAI introduced several key tools:â€‹-Responses API: A new API primitive that combines the simplicity of Chat Completions with the tool-use capabilities of the Assistants API, enabling developers to build agents that can perform complex tasks using multiple tools and model turns.â€‹- Built-in Tools:â€‹-Web Search:Allows agents to retrieve real-time information from the web, enhancing their ability to provide up-to-date responses.â€‹-File Search: Enables agents to access and search through large volumes of documents, useful for tasks like customer support or legal assistance.â€‹-Computer Use: Empowers agents to perform tasks on a user's behalf, such as navigating websites or executing commands, using OpenAI's Operator model.â€‹-Agents SDK: A toolkit that helps developers orchestrate single-agent and multi-agent workflows, simplifying the management and coordination of complex tasks.â€‹These tools streamline core agent logic, orchestration, and interactions, making it significantly easier for developers to build useful and reliable agents. Over the coming weeks and months, OpenAI plans to release additional tools and capabilities to further simplify and accelerate the development of agentic applications on their platform.
Attendees: 12 Going

Title: Flight from 0 to exit
Hosts: Bayram Annakov
Date and Time: Wednesday, March 19 at 3:00 PM - 4:30 PM
Location: PingPong Room, Floor 13
Description: â€‹Hey everyone! Iâ€™m hosting a casual meetup to share the behind-the-scenes story of how my team and I grew App in the Air from zero users to exit. I want to pull back the curtain on all the not-so-glamorous momentsâ€”those frantic all-nighters, the constant pivoting, and the tough decisions that never make it into the glossy â€œstartup successâ€ headlines.â€‹Weâ€™ll dive into what went right (and definitely what went wrong), focusing on real lessons learned rather than just the highlight reel. Think topics like choosing what to build for a first MVP, talking to customers who might not even know they need your product yet, and wearing more hats than you ever thought possible.â€‹Come ready to swap stories, ask questions, and maybe walk away with a new perspective on your own projects. Looking forward to connecting and hearing your own war stories as well. See you there!

Title: Unlocking China: Part 3 - Politics
Hosts: Sam Lei
Date and Time: Friday, March 21 at 4:30 PM - 6:00 PM
Location: Network SchoolJalan Forest City 5, Pulau Satu 8, 81550 Gelang Patah, Johor Darul Ta'zim, Malaysia
Description: â€‹Hey everyone! Sam here!ğŸ‘‹ Welcome to our part 3 of our 4-part series on Chinaâ€”a country with a past as rich as its ambitions for the future. From ancient philosophies and revolutionary politics to cutting-edge tech and global trade, Chinaâ€™s story is as complex as it is influential.â€‹â€‹Thereâ€™s a lot of noise and half-truths out there about China. My goal with this series is to cut through the confusion and dive into what really drives this nation. Weâ€™ll be exploring four key themesâ€”history, culture, politics, and economicsâ€”to get a clear view of whatâ€™s happening behind the headlines.â€‹â€‹Hereâ€™s a sneak peek at what weâ€™ll cover:â€‹â€‹ğŸ“œHistory: How We Got Hereâ€‹â€‹Opium War to End of Civil War:From gunboats and opium to revolutions and warlordsâ€”how a "Century of Humiliation" set the stage for modern China.â€‹â€‹Civil War to Reform and Opening:Mao vs. Chiang, the birth of the PRC, and how Deng Xiaoping pressed â€˜resetâ€™ on everything.â€‹â€‹Reform and Opening to Made in China 2025:From "to get rich is glorious" to leading the world in AI and EVsâ€”Chinaâ€™s economic speedrun explained.â€‹â€‹ğŸ“šCulture: The Roots and Realitiesâ€‹â€‹The BIG Philosophies:Confucianism, Communism, and Pragmatismâ€”how these ideologies weave together to shape Chinese political and social thought.â€‹â€‹Chinese Business Culture:Guanxi, Face, and the High-Context, Low-Trust Societyâ€”decoding the unwritten rules that can make or break deals in China.â€‹â€‹Modern Youth Culture:From internet slang and Bilibili to cultural erosion and the battle for identityâ€”how Chinaâ€™s younger generations are reshaping and challenging tradition.â€‹â€‹ğŸ›Politics: Who Runs the Show and Howâ€‹â€‹Deng Xiaoping's 1992 Southern Tour, Lee Kuan Yew and Singapore:How a train ride and a city-state influenced Chinaâ€™s economic miracle. ğŸš„â€‹â€‹State, Party, and Utopia:How Chinaâ€™s unique governance system works and what makes it tickâ€”no cold war clichÃ©s, promise.â€‹â€‹Parallel Universes?:Breaking down the Chinese state organs and their U.S. counterpartsâ€”whoâ€™s the Congress and whoâ€™s the Supreme Court in Chinaâ€™s world?â€‹â€‹Beijingâ€™s Long-Term Vision:From common prosperity to technological self-relianceâ€”how Chinaâ€™s leadership is planning decades ahead to reshape the nationâ€™s future. ğŸŒâ€‹â€‹ğŸ“ŠEconomics: The Engine Behind the Dragonâ€‹â€‹Central Planning and State Capitalism:How China blends market mechanisms with state control to drive growth and maintain stabilityâ€”deciphering the role of SOEs, Five-Year Plans, and the â€œvisible handâ€ of Beijing.â€‹â€‹Debt, Real Estate, and Shadow Banking:Breaking down Chinaâ€™s economic Achilles' heelâ€”how debt-fueled growth and the property sectorâ€™s risks impact both domestic stability and global markets.â€‹â€‹Belt and Road and Beyond:Understanding Chinaâ€™s global economic strategyâ€”how infrastructure investments, trade agreements (like RCEP), and institutions (like AIIB) aim to reshape the world order.â€‹â€‹So, if youâ€™re ready to move past the headlines and really understand what makes China tickâ€”without getting lost in translationâ€”stick around. This is going to be one fascinating journey!â€‹â€‹Letâ€™s get started! ğŸš€
